thread.title: Revellers flood seaside for Brazilian 'mud street party' | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Revellers flood seaside for Brazilian 'mud street party' | Daily Mail Online

author: Rachael Burford For Mailonline
title: Revellers flood seaside for Brazilian 'mud street party' | Daily Mail Online
text: Revellers flood a small seaside town to get down and dirty during Brazilian 'mud street party' on the first day of carnival Revelers in the seaside town of Paraty on Saturday threw themselves into deposits of black, mineral-rich mud The celebration is known as 'Bloco da Lama', which translates from the Portuguese as 'Mud Street Party' Legend has it 'Bloco' was born after teens nearby smeared themselves with mud to discourage mosquitoes Party grew year after year, but revelers eventually were banned from parading in the town because of mess
